explanation: [0-0] In a grey mold lies a cooked, puffed-up yellow egg crepe with a red cartoon character on it. A right hand holds chopsticks on the crepe to the left. Above the crepe, a left hand holds a yellow container filled with egg batter. At the top of the frame are the national flags of South Korea and Japan and a black "VS".
[0-4] Then, the right hand taps the puffed-up crepe with the chopsticks, and immediately after, the chopsticks are put into the container with egg batter and stirred quickly.

[8-14] Afterward, the scene switches to a kitchen, where yellow egg batter sizzles in a black pan on a grey gas stove. The stove's flames flicker, and then the pan shakes gently. A pair of chopsticks appears above the frame and then disappears. Next, a right hand uses a spatula to fold the egg batter, and immediately after, the pan is shaken, and an egg crepe appears in the pan. On the countertop to the right are several bottles of different colors.

[14-16] Then, the scene switches again. An elderly man wearing a red chef's hat stands in front of a yellow table, holding a knife in his right hand and a pair of chopsticks and a brown knife sheath in his left hand. A finished egg crepe sits on a silver tray on the table. The old man then cuts the crepe open with the knife, splitting it open to both sides. He leans towards the left, and behind him are stacked some kitchen items.
